covid-message: COVID-19 is primarily airborne. breathing in invisible aerosols that float and slowly fill an indoor area are the way you are most likely to catch it.  Masks are your best personal defense here. In 2022, You need BETTER MASKS than simple cloth masks.
table-info: This table is about improvement in relative protection as you opt for better mask combinations
rows-info: Rows - masks the infectious person is wearing
column-info: Columns - masks the person who could be infected is wearing
n95-footer: N95, FFP2, KN95, and KF94 respirator standards differ slightly on minimum filtration effectiveness, breathability requirements, how they are tested and a few other small details. That said, our table shows them all the same. You should also check your sources carefully as all of these types of respirators have been counterfeited during the pandemic.
timeToInfectionModal: Average time before virus transmission from an infected (but possibly asymptomatic) person to a vulnerable/uninfected person occurs:
riskModal: Relative 'better' factor of transmission from an infected (but possibly asymptomatic) person to a vulnerable/uninfected person. Neither wearing a mask for the original (wild) variant is a 'better' factor of 1 X:
change-things-button: Change variants, risk representation or respirator standard
